description: Game doesn't even start 🙃

I think I haven't played this game in 20 years and the music used to be different! It's still a great game, but the original tracks have a stranglehold on my memory. Wish I knew enough to be able to patch the game to use the old tracks:( I wonder if I can track down a really old version and still play it
summary: Great game but I miss the old music!

description: There's lots of games like these all over the place. Mobile, flash, you name it. Despite that, this game still holds up very well alongside it's age. After almost 20 years, I'm very happy that Frozen Bubble is still maintained!
I've installed this game on every computer that has Ubuntu (or one of its derivatives). I love it!
summary: My favorite game available in the Ubuntu Store

description: Installed every time since either Debian Woody or Sarge.
One of the best games in Linux
Window is very small, crashes when trying to do full screen. I use a dual 2k monitor setup. The game itself is awesome.
summary: Best game ever, but needs to be updated

description: seems too slow. The space bar seems to be the fire but you have to keep hitting it several times before the shot is released. At that speed it is just no fun.
maybe it's nicely done, but there's no control about audio setting (neither mute of sound or music or change of volume), and you can't change the display size of that game.
summary: no audio settings, no display size change

description: nothing but a charming bubble game from the classic tux era. works perfectly.

The game itself is fun. After running the game the first time, the dialog was very small so I used the command prompt to run it fullscreen (frozen-bubble --fullscreen). That worked fine but when I quit the game, my Ubuntu OS display is extremely magnified, eventually freezes (no pun intended), and I can't do anything unless I hold the power button to shut my computer down. When I run the game by clicking on the icon now, it automatically makes it full-screen and I again run to the same issue of it magnifying my OS too large after I quit the game. Unfortunately I have to uninstall the game until there is a fix, which probably won't come.
summary: Fun game but messes up my OS

description: Can't use it, my cursor disappears and can't navigate through the game. I've used the game in the past and loved it.

Wonderful game but needs to be able to scale up the graphics. Its just a small window where I have problems reading the menus as its so small.
5 STAR on a smaller screen.
summary: Great game but not on HiDPI screens

description: Unrivaled, the best of the best!

This is a lovely clone of Puzzle Bobble and I installed it wanting to play, but I can't play it.

Don't get me wrong the game is perfectly playable but there's no way to turn the music off and that in my world is a cardinal sin. That's why I have to knock 2 stars off and only give it 3/5

The keys F11 and F12 are also useful (version 2.1.0 minimum): F11 allows to toggle the music, and F12 allows to toggle the sound (music plus sound effects). Additionally, keypad's minus and plus keys allow to alter sound volume.

http://www.frozen-bubble.org/faq/#functionkeys
ha ha ha it is fun
summary: it is fun and we play 2p a lot

description: If you have played puzzle bubble before, then you will love this.

If feel like there is no logic to what balls you get to shoot next. Some levels are consistently only winnable after the right succession of balls comes, you just have to restart them again and again. That is bad gameplay. Also, there is no consistent telling whether a ball will pass a gap or just stick in it, so that ruins strategically shooting balls into gaps. There ought to be a way of telling.
Can be played, yes, but there is a lot missing that would make it a fun challenge. Instead there are levels where the challenge (or rather nuisance) is to wait until the game is willing to yield just the right balls or where a ball will just then NOT pass a gap and ruin that level - requiring yet another restart.
summary: Badly programmed in some areas of gameplay

description:
The game is great, BUT ...

I think it is time that all the FOSS games developers will make a Steam Deck version of their games, or SD and SC profiles.

I tried this, and others, and it is difficult to setup them well (better if you dock it with mouse and keyboard to set up them well).
summary: It needs a Steam Deck profile

description: un peu facile.
c'est tres bien

Si le principe est simple, il faut de la pratique pour accéder aux niveaux élevés. Un défaut: les configurations se répètent dans différents niveaux. Un autre défaut: pas de sauvegarde de la partie en cours. Mais beaucoup de bon temps passé (des parties jusqu'à 3 heures et plus). Je recommande pour les amateurs du genre. Il m'a fallu plusieurs années pour me lasser.
